name: Privacy Policy - WoFHoo - A Powerful Work From Home Tools

children.name: PT SOLUSI MITRA KREASINDO (“SMK” or “Company” or “fsisystem.com” or “us” or “our site”) is the owner of the website www.fsisystem.com (the “Site”) (collectively and separately known as the “Services”). SMK is committed to protecting your privacy. We understand you want to store your personal information, safely and comfortably. This Privacy Policy is designed to help you decide whether to use the Services and in what way, and it explains how we collect, store, and use information with individuals who will use the Services..
AGREEING TO THE USE OF INFORMATION
AGREEING TO THE USE OF INFORMATION

This Policy is a legally binding agreement between you (“you” or “users”) and us. By visiting, accessing or using the Site (“fsisystem.com”), or providing information to us in another format, you agree to and accept the terms of this Privacy Policy which is changed from time to time and you also agree with the collection and use of information in the manner specified in this Policy. We encourage you to review this Policy carefully and periodically to understand the changes that might occur in the future. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO THE PRIVACY POLICY TERMS, PLEASE STOP USING SERVICES IMMEDIATELY.This Privacy Policy answers the following questions:What information do we collect?What is the purpose of gathering this information?Who else received this information?

We collect two types of data and information from you: (1) Non-Personal Information — We retain some non-personal information identified as (“Non-Personal Information”), such as geo-location, web request, browser type, browser language, web pages that you visit before or after visiting our Site, URL, platform type, click number, landing page, view page, the order of the pages, and time spent on the page. This information is collected and stored for security reasons and so that we can audit and track usage statistics, audit our affiliates, and calculate payments to third parties. “Cookies” — Non-Personal Information is collected through the use of cookies so that when accessing or using this Site, we may use one or more cookies. Cookies are small text files placed on a user’s device that allow a Site to remember user preferences. Detailed information about cookies and how we use them on websites and other websites that implement our web tools can be found in our Cookies Policy, which also explains how you can disable cookies or control them. “Web Beacons” — We also use a software technology called “clear gifs” or known as Web Beacons (visible images that are often referred to as pixel tags or clear GIFs) on our site to recognize users, assess traffic patterns, identify content likes, and monitoring behavior also collects data about visitors who view web pages. We also include web beacons in our e-mail messages, including newsletters, to count how many e-mail messages have been opened. We also use trusted third parties to collect information, through the use of web beacons, browser cookies, and other tracking technologies. We may collect various data provided by your browser while you are on our site through web beacons. This data is collected in the aggregate but can include or be related to other non-personal information or personal information that users have voluntarily submitted. “Internet Protocol Address” — Your web browser or e-mail application will automatically provide an Internet Protocol (“IP address”) address to other computers that are communicating with you via the internet so they know where to send information. We receive an IP address every time you see one of our webpages because the browser automatically reports to us. We can also save IP addresses when you register to fsisystem.com, send messages, or buy things from us. We can use IP addresses for various purposes, including; (i) Diagnose service or technology problems; (ii) Assess and maintain security systems; (iii) Showing the most appropriate ad or content; (iv) Learn how people use our site and how we can improve it; (v) Reporting to advertisers about aggregate, but not individual, information obtained from IP addresses.

(2) Personal Information — “Personal Information” is information that may be personal or sensitive, including name, gender, telephone number, e-mail address or mailing address, and IP address. We collect the following personal information from you when you create an account (“Account”) on the website needed to access certain parts of the Services: full name, email address, password, and telephone number. As an alternative, you can also create an Account using your credentials from a designated third-party site or service, such as Facebook, Google+ or Twitter (“Third-Party Account”). Doing this will allow you to log in to your account through your Third-Party Account. If you choose this option, a Third-Party Account or pop-up box will appear when creating your account, where you need to approve and proceed with opening an account, and which will later explain what types of information we get from and the types of activities we get in connection with your Third-Party Account. Such information may be (but is not limited to) Personal Information stored on this Third-Party Account, such as your username, email address, profile picture, gender, date of birth, and other information that you have chosen to create a profile on such as a Third-Party Account. Please note that after your Account is opened, we will have access to personal information through Third-Party Accounts and also depend on the privacy settings of individuals in these Third-Party Accounts and privacy policies managed by providers such as Third-Party Accounts.
We treat any Non-Personal Information that is specifically connected or related to Personal Information as Personal Information.

We may share your e-mail address and telephone number with certain parties and sponsors (called “Sponsors”) in the time that you have permitted to receive promotional material from the Sponsor at the time of registration (we usually call “Subscriber”). Sponsors can periodically use email addresses and telephone numbers to provide you with promotional material if permission is given at the time of registration and you have not stopped subscribing at a later time under the provisions of this Government Regulation. If you unsubscribe, we will delete your email address and telephone number from our marketing distribution list. However, you may also need to separately unsubscribe from marketing offers sent by the Sponsor..

The collection and processing of Personal Information are intended to provide you with services, to send marketing and offers to products or services that we think are relevant to you, and to fulfill other purposes as set out in this privacy policy. The company will retain this data as long as we believe that the data is needed and suitable for the provision and management of our services.Access, Correction, Cancellation, and ObjectionYou have the right to access, correct, update, or object to use your Personal Information by making a written request to us using the Contact Us page. Your request will be handled in a fast and professional manner.

The company treats Personal Information in strict confidentiality, and the server where this data will be stored includes industry-standard security measures needed to prevent accidental or unlawful damage, loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure. However, we cannot fully guarantee the security of your information, which may be accessed, disclosed, altered, or destroyed, and it must be emphasized that you share this information at your own risk.

This Privacy Policy only applies to the Services, and our web tools that are integrated or implemented on other third party websites. This policy does not apply to third party websites, related to our Site. Third-party sites or services may have their privacy policies and we recommend that you read them carefully. The inclusion of links to third party sites or services is not a recommendation from those sites or services. Third-party sites may contain information or services that are illegal or that some people may find inappropriate or offensive. Before using third party sites and services or before making a purchase, we recommend that you read and understand the privacy policy and terms and conditions of these third-party sites and services, and warranties for the products purchased. You are aware and voluntary assuming all risks use third-party sites to buy products and services. You acknowledge and agree that we have no responsibility regarding these third party sites and their use.

We can transfer or assign your information, without notice, and without the need to receive your approval to third parties as a result of changes in control, consolidation, merger, acquisition, or reorganization. You acknowledge that in the event of bankruptcy, or curatorial, we may not have control over the use and transfer of Personal Information..

Privacy Policy is subject to modification. Please check the “Recent changes” heading at the bottom of this document to see when this Privacy Policy was last updated. Any changes to this Privacy Policy will be effective when we post the revised Privacy Policy on this Site. Use of the Site or the Services or the provision of your personal information and changes indicate that you accept the updated Privacy Policy.
